title: CHANGE THIS TO BE THE TITLE OF YOUR POST
text:
This is something else entirely.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(patchwork)
library(gt)

offensepassing2018 <- read_csv("OffensePassing2018.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2018, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season)) 

offensepassing2019 <- read_csv("OffensePassing2019.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2019, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

offensepassing2020 <- read_csv("OffensePassing2020.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2020, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

offensepassing2021 <- read_csv("OffensePassing2021.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2021, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

offensepassing2022 <- read_csv("OffensePassing2022.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2022, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

offensepassing2023 <- read_csv("OffensePassing2023.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2023, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

rushingoffense2018 <- read_csv("RushingOffense2018.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2018, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season)) |> rename(Yards = YardsYards)

rushingoffense2019 <- read_csv("RushingOffense2019.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2019, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

rushingoffense2020 <- read_csv("RushingOffense2020.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2020, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

rushingoffense2021 <- read_csv("RushingOffense2021.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2021, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

rushingoffense2022 <- read_csv("RushingOffense2022.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2022, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

rushingoffense2023 <- read_csv("RushingOffense2023.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2023, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

turnovermargin2018 <- read_csv("TurnoverMargin2018.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2018, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

turnovermargin2019 <- read_csv("TurnoverMargin2019.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2019, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

turnovermargin2020 <- read_csv("TurnoverMargin2020.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2020, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

turnovermargin2021 <- read_csv("TurnoverMargin2021.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2021, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

turnovermargin2022 <- read_csv("TurnoverMargin2022.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2022, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

turnovermargin2023 <- read_csv("TurnoverMargin2023.csv") |> mutate(Season = 2023, NameSeason = paste(Name, Season))

offensepassing <- bind_rows(offensepassing2018, offensepassing2019, offensepassing2020, offensepassing2021, offensepassing2022, offensepassing2023)

rushingoffense <- bind_rows(rushingoffense2018, rushingoffense2019, rushingoffense2020, rushingoffense2021, rushingoffense2022, rushingoffense2023)

turnovermargin <- bind_rows(turnovermargin2018, turnovermargin2019, turnovermargin2020, turnovermargin2021, turnovermargin2022, turnovermargin2023)


passingjoin <- offensepassing |> 
  select(Season, Name, NameSeason, Yards) |> 
  rename(PassingYards = Yards)

rushingjoin <- rushingoffense |> 
  select(Season, Name, NameSeason, Yards) |> 
  rename(RushingYards = Yards)

totaloffense <- passingjoin |> 
  inner_join(rushingjoin)

nu <- totaloffense |> filter(Name == "Nebraska")

line1 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=totaloffense, aes(x=Season, y=RushingYards, group=Name), color="lightgrey") +
  geom_line(data=nu, aes(x=Season, y=RushingYards, group=Name), color="red") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 2022) +
  geom_text(aes(x=2021.9, y=3000, label="Frost fired")) +
  labs(
    x="", 
    y="Average Rushing Yards") + 
  theme_minimal() 

line2 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=totaloffense, aes(x=Season, y=PassingYards, group=Name), color="lightgrey") +
  geom_line(data=nu, aes(x=Season, y=PassingYards, group=Name), color="red") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 2022) +
  geom_text(aes(x=2021.9, y=3000, label="Frost fired")) +
  labs(
    x="", 
    y="Average Passing Yards") + 
  theme_minimal() 
    
  line1 + line2  + 
  plot_annotation(
    title = "Rushing vs. Passing: Another Year, Another Coach",
    subtitle = "A comparative look of rushing and passing yards between two different coaching staffs.",
    caption = "Source: CFBStats | By LeAnne Krueger"
  ) & 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )











Code
big <- turnovermargin |> 
  group_by(Name) |> 
  summarise(
    Gain = sum(`Total Gain`),
    Lost = sum(`Total Lost`)
  ) |>
  top_n(10, wt=Lost) |> 
  pivot_longer(
    cols=-Name,
    names_to = "Turnovers",
    values_to = "Total"
  )

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=big, aes(x=reorder(Name, Total), weight=Total, fill=Turnovers)) + 
  coord_flip() + 
scale_fill_manual(values = c("red","black")) +
  labs(
    title = "Nebraska's Turnover Margin Isn't As Bad As You Think",
    subtitle = "Huskers in the top 10 for turnover margin, but not in a way that leaves a good impression.",
    caption = "Source: CFBStats | By LeAnne Krueger",
    x="",
    y="Number of Turnovers"
  ) + 
 theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 











Code
passingaverage <- offensepassing |> 
  filter(Name=="Nebraska") |>
  select(Season, Name, `Yards/Att`) |> 
  rename(PassingAverage = `Yards/Att`)

rushingaverage <- rushingoffense |> 
  select(Season, Name, `Avg.`) |> 
  rename(RushingAverage = `Avg.`)

averageyards <- passingaverage |> 
  inner_join(rushingaverage)

averageyards |> 
  gt() |> 
  cols_label(
    PassingAverage = "Passing Average",
    RushingAverage = "Rushing Average"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "Which Coaching Staff is Effectively Moving the Ball?",
    subtitle = "The average amount of yards per play is reflecting the gradual momentum of Nebraska's offense."
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** LeAnne Krueger |  **Source:** CFBStats")
  ) |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=12)
     )
   ) |>
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |>
  data_color(
    columns = vars(PassingAverage),
    colors = scales::col_numeric(
      palette = c(
        "white", "orange", "red"),
      domain = NULL)
  )  |>
  data_color(
    columns = vars(RushingAverage),
    colors = scales::col_numeric(
      palette = c(
        "white", "orange", "red"),
      domain = NULL)
  )









Which Coaching Staff is Effectively Moving the Ball?


The average amount of yards per play is reflecting the gradual momentum of Nebraska's offense.

By: LeAnne Krueger | Source: CFBStats

title: Introduction
text: Hello, my name is LeAnne Krueger and I am a 3rd year student at the University of Nebraska - Lincoln studying advertising and public relations with sports media and communications.
